content:
• Monday, December 17, 2018
  • MRIN

    Marin Software +50% on Google revenue sharing deal, updated guidance

    • Marin Software (NASDAQ:MRIN) +50.7% after-hours on news it entered into a three-year revenue sharing agreement with Google to further develop the company's enterprise tech platform and software products.
    • MRIN will receive revenue payments from Google based on "revenue generated on the company's tech platform in connection with the company's clients' spend on search ads... appearing on Google Search only, during a relevant calendar quarter" and "in connection with its clients' spend on search ads appearing on the eligible search engines... excluding Google Search, during the relevant contract year," according to an SEC filing.
    • As a result of the Google deal, MRIN updates Q4 guidance, now expecting revenue of $14.6M-$15.1M after earlier forecasting $11.6M-$12.1M and anticipates an adjusted operating loss of $2.4M-$2.9M instead of its previous outlook for a loss of $5.4M-$5.9M.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • PBYI

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (12/17/2018)

    • Top Gainers: PBYI +9.2%. SND +7.2%. BRY +3.6%.
    • Top Losers: ACHN -4.1%. CTT -2.3%. TVIX -1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • EHTH

    EHealth files for $150M mixed shelf offering

    • EHealth (NASDAQ:EHTH) has filed a prospectus for a $150M mixed shelf offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • GLPG

    Galapagos commences late-stage studies of GLPG1690 in IPF; shares up 1% after hours

    • Galapagos NV (NASDAQ:GLPG) is up 1% after hours on the heels of its announcement that dosing is underway in its Phase 3 program for autotaxin inhibitor GLPG1690 in patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF).
    • The program consists of two Phase 3s: ISABELA1 and ISABELA2, assessing GLPG1690 plus standard-of-care treatment. Both should wind up in late 2021.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • MOTS

    Motus GI launches stock offering

    • Motus GI Holdings (NASDAQ:MOTS) initiates a public offering of 5M shares of common stock. Price and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • CLXT

    Calyxt nabs European patent for method of gene editing plants; shares up 1% after hours

    • Calyxt (NASDAQ:CLXT) is up 1% after hours in reaction to its announcement that the European Patent Office has issued it a new patent covering methods to create gene-edited plants by transient delivery of sequence-specific nucleases, including CRISPR/Cas9.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 9 Comments
  • PBYI

    Puma Bio's neratinib shows positive action in late-stage breast cancer study; shares up 9% after hours

    • Results from a Phase 3 clinical trial, NALA, evaluating Puma Biotechnology's (NYSE:PBYI) lead drug PB272 (neratinib) in treatment-resistant HER2-positive breast cancer patients showed a positive effect.
    • The study assessed neratinib plus capecitabine [Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) Xeloda] compared to Novartis' (NYSE:NVS) Tykerb (lapatinib) plus capecitabine in a third-line setting. Patients in the neratinib arm experienced a statistically significant improvement in centrally confirmed progression-free survival (PFS) versus lapatinib + capecitabine. Overall survival favored neratinib but the separation fell short of statistical significance.
    • Complete results will be submitted to global health authorities and for presentation at a future medical conference.
    • Shares are up 9% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM | 4 Comments
  • BBY

    Negative read on consumer electronics/toys spending

    • Bank of America Merrill Lynch credit card data shows a 6% drop in spending on consumer electronics and toys for November. The sharp drop during the month is the biggest recorded over the last few years.
    • The BAML chart on consumer electronics/toys sales was buried in a downgrade note posted by the firm earlier today on Best Buy (NYSE:BBY), but certainly seems relevant to Mattel (NASDAQ:MAT) and Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 7 Comments
  • ORCL

    Oracle +3.5% on Q2 beats

    • Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) gains 3.5% after reporting Q2 beats and in-line and better segment results. Guidance will come on the earnings call.
    • Revenue breakdown: Cloud Services and License Support, $6.64B (consensus: $6.63B); Cloud License and On-Premise License, $1.22B (consensus: $1.18B); Hardware, $891M ($891.9M); Services, $817M ($817.7M).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Oracle beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Dec. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 8 Comments
  • ACHN

    Achillion up 2% after hours on positive ACH-4471 data

    • Achillion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACHN) is up 2% after hours in response to its announcement of interim data from its Phase 2 studies of complement factor D inhibitor ACH-4471, alone and with a C5 inhibitor, in patients with paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH) and C3 glomerulopathy (C3G). The company says it has demonstrated proof of concept in both indications. It plans to review the results with the FDA in Q4 2019.
    • Its next-generation factor D inhibitors, ACH-5228 and ACH-5548, are in Phase 1 development.
    • Management will host a conference call at 4:30 pm ET to discuss the data.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 14 Comments

  • Averages give back another 2%

    • A bit of buying into the close took the averages off of their worst levels, but the Dow and S&P 500 still shed 2.1% and the Nasdaq 2.3%.
    • The S&P 500 is now at a new low for the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 10 Comments
  • MAT

    Mattel slumps to 52-week low

    • Mattel (NASDAQ:MAT) is down 5.55% amid more concerns on the  impact of China tariffs to the company's bottom line.
    • Shares carved out a new 52-week low of $10.86 earlier in the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • GSAT

    Globalstar +26% on litigation settlement, 3GPP approval

    • Globalstar (GSAT +26.6%) surges on news it settled a lawsuit with minority shareholders, agreeing to sweeping changes in its corporate governance designed partly to prevent transactions by Executive Chairman Jay Monroe.
    • GSAT will add three new "seasoned telecom executives" to its board to fill three vacancies left by existing board members.
    • Also, GSAT said the Third Generation Partnership Project approved a global standard for use of some spectrum that the company owns but has struggled to monetize.
    • 3GPP designates GSAT’s terrestrial S-band as Band 53, which now permits LTE services in the U.S. with additional geographies expected to be added in 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 7 Comments
  • NLY

    Mortgage REITs taking no heart from declining rates

    • The mortgage REIT sector might seem to welcome what could be at least the temporary end of the Fed's rate hike cycle. Not today, though. With the S&P 500 down 2.4%, the 10-year Treasury yield at a new multi-month low, and traders bailing on rate hike expectations for next year (not to mention this week), the iShares Mortgage Real Estate Capped ETF (BATS:REM) is down 3.25%.
    • Individual players: Annaly Capital (NLY -2.5%), AGNC Investment (AGNC -2%), Two Harbors (TWO -2.6%), Armour (ARR -3.7%), Orchid Island (ORC -8.2%), Western Asset (WMC -6.6%), Invesco (IVR -3.4%), Dynex (DX -3.7%), Capstead (CMO -4.9%), PennyMac (PMT -5.5%)
    • ETFs: MORL, REM, MORT
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 58 Comments
  • PSEC

    BDCs punished in selloff

    • BDCs might be income favorites, but they're also proxies for general corporate credit, which is under pressure. And that might be particularly so in the oil patch, with crude once again plunging below $50 per barrel.
    • Among today's movers: Prospect Capital (PSEC -4.9%), Main Street Capital (MAIN -4.9%), Ares Capital (ARCC -5.2%), Apollo Investment (AINV -4.7%), Gladstone Investment (GAIN -4.9%), Newtek Business (NEWT -8.1%), PennantPark (PNNT -6.6%), Blackrock TCP (TCPC -4.9%), Goldman Sachs BDC (GSBD -5.1%)
    • ETFs: BDCL, BDCS, BIZD, FGB, LBDC
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 189 Comments

  • Utilities, REITs slammed along with rest of market

    • Not even defensive plays are working today, with utilities (XLU -3.2%) and REITs (IYR -2.9%) down even more than the broader averages.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield, meanwhile, is down four basis points to a multi-month low of 2.855%, and traders continue to see about a 50% chance of a Fed rate hike this week (we'd put the odds at closer to zero). TLT +0.55%, TBT -1.1%
    • ETFs: VNQ, IYR, XLU, UTG, RQI, VPU, SCHH, RNP, RFI, GUT, IDU, KBWY, DRN, BUI, NRO, URE, ICF, XLRE, JRS, RWR, SRS, FUTY, FREL, DRA, DRV
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 102 Comments
  • UEEC

    United Health Products to host business update December 20; shares up 2%

    • United Health Products (OTCPK:UEEC +1.7%) will host a conference call on Thursday, December 20, at 11:30 am ET to update investors on its business.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • BASFY

    BASF to keep raising prices to offset higher raw material costs, CFO says

    • BASF (OTCQX:BASFY -1.4%) is planning more price increases in 2019 to offset the impact of higher raw materials costs, CFO Hans-Ulrich Engel says in a WSJ interview.
    • BASF has raised prices by 5%-6% across its product range since the beginning of 2018 but the CFO says this has not been sufficient to offset the temporary run-up in oil and gas prices that is affecting the company's downstream business.
    • Brent crude oil prices topped $85/bbl earlier in the fall, and BASF this year paid €4-€5 more for each kilowatt-hour of gas compared with last year, according to Engel, who says the company is "countering with price hikes... but it takes a while to push them through," adding that the recent oil price decline complicates the task.
    • Analysts say BASF was late to raise prices in response to higher input costs, and now that raw material costs are again pulling lower, the company is struggling to explain the continued price increases to its customers.
    • The U.K.’s exit from the European Union could present more challenges for the company, Engel says: BASF is concerned by the prospect of a no-deal Brexit, as the EU’s regulatory framework for chemicals might no longer apply to the U.K. and could lead to a regulatory vacuum that could force the company to stop supplying its customers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • TMUS

    WSJ: CFIUS clears T-Mobile, Sprint merger

    • WSJ sources say the Committee on Foreign Investment in the U.S. has approved the T-Mobile (TMUS -1.3%) and Sprint (S -1.8%) merger, clearing the deal of potential national security issues.
    • The deal still needs approval from the FCC and Justice Department. T-Mobile execs expect those decisions in 2H19.
    • Post updated to correct FTC to FCC.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 3 Comments
  • ETSY

    Aegis names internet M&A potentials for 2019

    • Aegis Capital analyst Victor Anthony thinks several SMID cap Internet names might be acquisition targets if the economy slows next year.
    • Anthony lists the potential targets as Etsy (ETSY -6%), Yelp (YELP -3.7%), Shutterfly (SFLY -5.7%), Groupon (GRPN -3.5%), GrubHub (GRUB -4.1%), Wayfair (W -9.9%), Snap (SNAP -5.2%) and Criteo (CRTO +1.5%). Potential buyers stretch across large cap internet/tech stocks and PE firms.
    • The analyst expects activist investors to push eBay (EBAY -1.2%) for the sale of the Classifieds and StubHub businesses. EBAY could use the cash for repurchases and a "transformative" acquisition.
    • Other predictions/suggestions: IAC (IAC -4.1%) spinning off Match Group (MTCH -4.7%) shares and making a "large" acquisition and regulators pressuring Amazon (AMZN -4.3%) to split in two, though a forced split likely years away.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 7 Comments
  • TZOO

    NTNX, TZOO and BVSN among tech movers

    • Gainers: Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO) +12%.  Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) +11%. Upwork (NASDAQ:UPWK) +6%. Akoustis Technologies (NASDAQ:AKTS) +6%. Gravity (NASDAQ:GRVY) +6%.
    • Losers: BroadVision (NASDAQ:BVSN) -15%. ShotSpotter (NASDAQ:SSTI) -14%. SVMK (NASDAQ:SVMK) -12%. Nutanix (NASDAQ:NTNX) -13%. FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • XPO

    XPO Logistics bounces back

    • XPO Logistics (NYSEMKT:XPO) is up 4.50% in a comeback bid from last week's decline.
    • Spruce Point Capital issued an update to one of its slides in relation to organic operating cash flow growth, although the firm says the major conclusion of its short report still stands.
    • Previously: Spruce Point Capital hammers XPO Logistics (Dec. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • CDE

    Gold gains as stocks slide; many precious metals miners post strong gains

    • Gold futures settle at their highest level in more than a week, helped by weakness in the dollar and losses in the stock market; Comex February gold settles +0.8% at $1,251.80/oz.
    • "One of the drivers that is pushing gold higher right now is the flight to safety [due to lower equities], along with the dollar being sold off a bit," says Michael Matousek, head trader at U.S. Global Investors.
    • Investor sentiment toward gold is showing signs of optimism, as speculators switched to a net long position in gold of 10,252 contracts, adding 11,791 contracts in the week to Dec. 11, the first time gold speculators have held a net long position since July.
    • Many precious metals miners post large gains in a sea of red for most stocks: CDE +13%, EGO +9.6%, PVG +9.6%, AGI +9.3%, AUY +7.5%, HL +7.4%, BVN +7.2%, IAG +5.5%, EXK +5%, KGC +3.8%.
    • ETFs: GLD, GDX, NUGT, GDXJ, JNUG, GGN, DUST, IAU, PHYS, JDST, SGOL, GOEX, UGLD, SGDM, UGL, DGP, GLL, ASA, GTU, GLDI, OUNZ, RING, DZZ, SGDJ, DGL, DGLD, TGLDX, DGZ, PSAU, GOAU, GDXX, GYEN, BAR, GEUR, GDXS, GLDW, GHS, UBG, QGLDX, GHE, MELT, AAAU, GLDM, IAUF
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 49 Comments
  • TWTR

    Twitter: Resolved issue could tie to state actors

    • Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) resolves an issue with one of its complaint forms that could have revealed the country code for a user's phone number associated with the account.
    • The issue was fixed on November 16, and the company says it did not expose full phone numbers or other personal information.
    • Twitter says it received a large number of enquiries from IP address in China and Saudi Arabia and that "it is possible that some of these IP addresses may have ties to state-sponsored actors.”
    • Twitter shares are down 6% to $33.63.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 6 Comments
  • GTE

    Gran Tierra Energy hits record production growth, expects more in 2019

    • Gran Tierra Energy (GTE -2.1%) is lower despite announcing record production growth, as current output hits 40K boe/day amid what so far is record quarterly production of 38,220 boe/day, up 6% from Q3 and 11% higher than the year-ago period.
    • For FY 2019, GTE forecasts production of 40K-42K boe/day, representing organic growth of 12%-18% over the first nine months of 2018 and includes no volumes for any potential exploration success including Pomorroso-1.
    • GTE also says it plans a 2019 capital budget of $350M-$370M and forecasts cash flow of $365M-$375M at a $65/bbl Brent oil price.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 22 Comments
  • COST

    JPMorgan sticks with Costco

    • JPMorgan takes some lumps for riding into Costco's (COST -1.9%) earnings report with a positive view on the retailer.
    • "We share the pain of the 8% stock pullback, and acknowledge that our core margin estimates were too high," says analyst Chritopher Horvers, who is still positive on the name.
    • "It’s a consumer staples stock with low tariff risk, so it’s defensive into a slowing consumer environment in 2019, writes Horvers. "And it is difficult to find mid-single-digit-plus longer term topline growth with very low Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN)/brand risk," he adds.
    • Shares of Costco are down 8% over the last three weeks, Analyst sentiment still leans to the bullish side (17 Buy-equivalent ratings, 11 Hold-equivalent ratings, 1 Sell-equivalent rating).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 12 Comments
  • JNJ

    J&J chief Gorsky defends talc powder; shares remain under pressure, down 4%

    • In a video statement, Johnson & Johnson (JNJ -3.9%) Chairman & CEO Alex Gorsky reiterates the company's position that its talc powder is pure, free of contaminants and has not caused cancer or asbestos-related disease. He cites repeated testing over many years by global authorities that has always confirmed the product's integrity and lack of asbestos, adding that the company would have immediately withdrawn the product from the market if it was found to contain such contaminants.
    • Previously: Johnson & Johnson down 4% on reports of prior knowledge of asbestos in baby powder (Dec. 14)
    • Update: Reuters reports that the company is taking out full-page newspaper ads defending its talc and its business practices.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 38 Comments
  • GS

    Goldman defends itself, saying it was lied to in 1MDB scandal

    • Following Malaysia's charges against Goldman Sachs (GS -2.6%) over the 1MDB scandal, the U.S. bank defends itself, saying it was the victim of deceptive Malaysian officials.
    • "Certain members of the former Malaysian government and 1MDB lied to Goldman Sachs, outside counsel, and others about the use of proceeds from these transactions," the bank said in a statement.
    • Previously: Malaysia files criminal charges against Goldman (Dec. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 11 Comments
  • CDE

    Coeur Mining and Legacy Reserves among Energy/Materials gainers; Approach Resources and Yield10 Bioscience among losers

    • Gainers: Coeur Mining (NYSE:CDE) +16%. Legacy Reserves (NASDAQ:LGCY) +12%. Pretium Resources (NYSE:PVG) +10%. Alamos Gold (NYSE:AGI) +10%. Hecla Mining (NYSE:HL) +8%.
    • Losers: Approach Resources (NASDAQ:AREX) -12%. Yield10 Bioscience (NASDAQ:YTEN) -10%. Aceto (NASDAQ:ACET) -9%. VAALCO Energy (NYSE:EGY) -9%. BP Midstream Partners (NYSE:BPMP) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • CLVS

    Activist investor urges Clovis to pursue sale; shares down 9%

    • Bloomberg reports that activist investor Armistice Capital LLC has been urging Clovis Oncology (CLVS -8.8%) to pursue a sale in the wake of GlaxoSmithKline's $5.1B bid for PARP competitor TESARO (TSRO +0.1%) despite the expectations that its PARP inhibitor Zejula (niraparib) is not expected to reach the $1B sales mark until 2023, hardly a surprising move by the owner of a 9.8% stake in CLVS who wants to avoid a potential loss.
    • Clovis' Rubraca (rucaparib) is supposed to be a blockbuster as well but it has generated only $82M in sales over the past four quarters.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 13 Comments
  • NVR

    Homebuilder stocks gain as voices call for Fed to halt hikes

    • Most homebuilders are in the green in early afternoon as President Trump, his trade adviser Peter Navarro, and investor Jeffrey Gundlach agree that the Fed's FOMC shouldn't increase interest rates when they meet later this week.
    • iShares Dow Jones US Home Construction ETF (BATS:ITB) rises 0.1% compared with the S&P 500 declining 1.0%.
    • Among individual homebuilding names: NVR (NVR +1.3%), Toll Brothers (TOL +0.7%), PulteGroup (PHM +0.9%), Lennar (LEN +0.3%), and TRI Pointe Homes (TPH +2.3%).
    • Earlier today, NAHB Housing Market Index of 56 falls short of consensus of 61 and slips from November's reading of 60.
    • Previously: Gundlach says Fed shouldn't hike, "pretty sure" stocks are in bear territory (Dec. 17)
    • ETFs: XHB, ITB, PKB, NAIL, HOML
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • MCD

    Chick-fil-A gobbles up more market share

    • Chick-fil-A sales are up 15.5% this year on a double-digit traffic gain, according to data from Restaurant Business. The continued momentum for the chain has it on the verge of passing Subway to become the third largest restaurant concept in the U.S. as it continues to nab market share from McDonald's (MCD -0.5%), Burger King (QSR -1.3%), Taco Bell (YUM -1.6%), Wendy's (WEN -1.9%) and others.
    • "We have long pointed out that Chick-fil-A is the restaurant competition with which McDonald’s U.S. should most concern itself – and by extension, investors should too," notes Kalinowski Research analysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 38 Comments
  • LION

    Fidelity Southern leads financial gainers; First Capital and Colony Capital among losers

    • Gainers: Fidelity Southern (NASDAQ:LION) +20%. Ocwen Financial (NYSE:OCN) +10%. KCAP Financial (NASDAQ:KCAP) +9%. InnSuites Hospitality Trust (NYSEMKT:IHT) +6%. LM Funding America (NASDAQ:LMFA) +5%.
    • Losers: Wheeler Real Estate Investment Trust (NASDAQ:WHLR) -13%. Cedar Realty Trust (NYSE:CDR) -9%. PPDAI Group (NYSE:PPDF) -9%. First Capital (NASDAQ:FCAP) -8%. Colony Capital (NYSE:CLNY) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • DFFN

    Microcaps mostly among midday movers

    • Gainers: Diffusion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:DFFN) +42%. NRC Group Holdings (NYSEMKT:NRCG) +22%. Fidelity Southern (NASDAQ:LION) +21%. HyreCar (NASDAQ:HYRE) +18%. YRC Worldwide (NASDAQ:YRCW) +19%. Axovant Sciences (NASDAQ:AXON) +17%. AgeX Therapeutics (NYSEMKT:AGE) +15%. Coeur Mining (NYSE:CDE) +15%. Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO) +14%. Legacy Reserves (NASDAQ:LGCY) +13%.
    • Losers: Sophiris Bio (NASDAQ:SPHS) -41%. Dova Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:DOVA) -31%. ReTo Eco-Solutions (NASDAQ:RETO) -21%. Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) -21%. Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) -20%. NF Energy Saving (NASDAQ:NFEC) -19%. SPI Energy (NASDAQ:SPI) -18%. Meili (NYSE:MOGU) -16%. Aileron Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALRN) -15%. Achillion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACHN) -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • TPR

    Wells Fargo defends retail

    • Wells Fargo checks in on the retail sector amid the "wall of worry" that seems to be piling up.
    • "While there are many potential reasons for the sell-off (concerns about potentially slowing growth/tough compares, uncertainty around China, the never-ending e-commerce threat, etc.) - we think it’s interesting that recent fundamentals have actually been decent," writes the WF analyst team.
    • "Basically, 3Q comps on average across our space were in the +2-3% range (for the 4th quarter in a row), and early reads on Holiday gave actually been relatively solid (especially Black Friday)."
    • After a tactical look at retail stocks by Wells - Tapestry (TPR +0.9%), Lululemon (LULU +1.1%), Carter's (CRI -0.7%), L Brands (LB -2.3%) and Foot Locker (FL -1.2%) emerge as interesting picks amid the weakness.
    • Some of today's largest decliners are Farfetch (FTCH -10.8%), Stitch Fix (SFIX -5.8%), Duluth Holdings (DLTH -4.8%), Tailored Brands (TLRD -4.3%), Shoe Carnival (SCVL -3.4%), Boot Barn (BOOT -3.6%), Williams-Sonoma (WSM -2.6%) and Target (TGT -2.6%).
    • ETFs: XLY, XRT, VCR, RTH, RETL, FDIS, IYK, FXD, EMTY, RCD, PMR, UGE, SZK, FTXD, JHMC
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 11 Comments
  • URGN

    UroGen launches rolling submission of U.S. marketing application for UGN-101; shares up 5%

    • Thinly traded UroGen Pharma (URGN +4.6%) is up on average volume in response to its announcement that it has initiated the rolling submission of its U.S. marketing application seeking approval for Orphan Drug- and Breakthrough Therapy-tagged UGN-101 (mitomycin gel) for the treatment of patients with low-grade upper tract urothelial cancer. It expects to complete the filing by mid-2019 and hopes to get the FDA nod by late 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • CYRX

    CryoPort announces $25M investment from Petrichor; shares up 8%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Cryoport (CYRX +7.8%) is up on below-average volume following its announcement that Petrichor Healthcare Capital Management has invested $25M in the company.
    • Petrichor bought 1M common shares at $10 per share plus funded a $15M note convertible into common shares at $13.11 per share. The interest rate on the five-year instrument is 3-month LIBOR plus 6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • GD

    General Dynamics slips as Trudeau says Canada may nix Saudi arms deal

    • General Dynamics (GD -1.6%) is lower after Canadian Prime Minister Trudeau said for the first time that his government was looking for a way out of a multibillion-dollar arms deal with Saudi Arabia.
    • The comments reflected a tougher tone from Trudeau, who previously talked about penalties for scrapping the $13B agreement for armored vehicles made by GD's Canadian unit.
    • “We are engaged with the export permits to try and see if there is a way of no longer exporting these vehicles to Saudi Arabia,” Trudeau said in a televised interview over the weekend, without offering further details.
    • Political opponents, citing the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi and Saudi Arabia’s involvement in the Yemen war, say Trudeau should end the GD deal, which was negotiated by the previous government.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 12 Comments
  • BGNE

    BeiGene's tislelizumab shows positive action in early-stage cancer study

    • Updated data from a Phase 1a/1b clinical trial evaluating BeiGene's (BGNE +2%) anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody tislelizumab in patients with advanced solid tumors continue to show a treatment benefit. The results were presented at the ESMO Immuno-Oncology Congress in Geneva.
    • The confirmed response rate was 29.4% (n=5/17), including one complete responder in 17 patients with urothelial carcinoma. Three additional patients experienced stable cancer implying a disease control rate (DCR) of 47.1% (n=8/17). Median duration of response was 18.7 months.
    • The response rate and DCR in patients with esophageal cancer were 11.1% and 37.0%, respectively. In gastric cancer patients, the response rate and DCR were 12.2% and 51.0%, respectively. In non-small lung cancer (NSCLC), the rates were 13.0% and 63.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • SPI

    SPI Energy -18% on Nasdaq delinquency notice

    • SPI Energy (SPI -18.2%) plunges after Nasdaq informs the company that it is not in compliance with continued listing standards because its market cap totaled less than $15M.
    • SPI says it is not eligible for the typical 180-day compliance period because the Nasdaq hearings panel earlier had determined to impose a panel monitor lasting through 2019.
    • SPI says the panel noted that if at any time during the monitor period the company fails any listing standard, Nasdaq would issue a delisting determination and schedule a new hearing.

    Drug distributors under modest pressure after 60 Minutes opioid piece

    • AmerisourceBergen (ABC -1%), McKesson (MCK -1.3%) and Cardinal Health (CAH -2.1%) are all in the red on below-average volume. Last night, 60 Minutes ran a piece on the opioid crisis, its second, in which the most prominent plaintiff attorney said that drug distributors have played a major role in the crisis by looking the other way regarding excessive shipments of opioid painkillers to small pharmacies in heavily affected areas like Ohio and West Virginia.
    • In a statement, McKesson calls the piece "one-sided" since it ignores the doctors who prescribe the drugs, the government agencies that license pharmacies, insurers that pay for the drugs and the DEA who sets the quotas, adding the many of the overdose deaths in the U.S. were due to illegal drugs, not prescription medications.

  • OVID

    Ovid's OV935 shows positive action in epilepsy study; shares up 1%

    • Ovid Therapeutics (OVID +1.3%) announces positive results from a Phase 1b/2a evaluating OV935/TAK-925 in 18 adult patients with treatment-resistant rare developmental and epileptic encephalopathies (DEE).
    • The study met the primary endpoint of safety and tolerability and showed a treatment effect in reducing seizure frequency that correlated with decreases in plasma 24-hydroxycholesterol (24HC).
    • OV925/TAK-935 inhibits an enzyme called cholesterol 24-hydroxylase (CH24H) which converts cholesterol into 24HC. CH24H plays a key role in the over-activation in a certain metabolic pathway related to CNS disorders like epilepsy.
    • Treated patients experienced a 45% reduction in seizure frequency from baseline at day 92. Total seizure-free days at day 92 were 14.0 compared to 11.7 at baseline.
    • Enrollment in an open-label extension study, ENDYMION, is in process as are two Phase 2 trials, ELEKTRA and ARCADE.
    • The company is developing the candidate with Takeda Pharmaceutical Company (TKPYY -3.8%) (TAK-935).
    • Previously: Takeda and Ovid Therapeutics expand clinical program for TAK-935/OV935 (July 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM

    • Vedanta (VEDL +1.9%) is higher after Italy’s National Green Tribunal said the company could restart its copper smelter, reversing an order from the Tamil Nadu state government to shut the 400K metric tons/year smelter.
    • The tribunal orders the state pollution board to approve the plant’s restart within three weeks and directed VEDL to spend 1B rupees ($14M) on community welfare over three years and implement pollution control and monitoring mechanisms.
    • The ruling was in line with the previous recommendations of a panel set up to give its opinion on the smelter.
    • In May, the Tamil Nadu government shut the facility after 13 people died when police opened fire on villagers protesting the pollution caused by the plant.
